data.title: Best place in Cambridge!
data.text: This hotel reminds me of a Victorian hotel in a British movie, except that it is so full of Americana.  They have different sorts of rooms from small to large and a very friendly, accommodating staff.  Location is excellent, price can't be beat in Cambridge, breakfast is fresh and tasty.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind review~! We look forward to seeing you again when your travels bring you back to Cambridge!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Indifference to comfort, even to safety
data.text:
My husband and I recently attended a conference at Harvard. We came by public transport and so needed a place nearby. Irving House seemed like the best of several pricey alternatives. Wrong! Our fourth floor room (no elevator), while clean, was tiny (for $366.24 including tax!). The shower stall was so small I couldn't bend over to wash my feet. Our uncomfortable queen-size bed was pushed against a wall, so I had to crawl over my husband to get to the bathroom in the night. Breakfasts are no better than ok.

None of this is positive, but what makes this B&B truly horrible is the indifference, shading into outright hostility, of the staff. When my husband tripped on those steep, narrow steps, right in front of the reception desk, one fellow guest stepped over him, while the guy at reception continued with his computer game. Nobody asked if he was ok. Nobody cared in spite of all those annoying placards scattered around the place exhorting us to care for the earth and each other. If you are a menopausal woman with hot flashes, be sure to avoid this place in the summer. Air-conditioning is not to be turned down below 75 degrees, or else!

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
NikaJunie,
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  While the size of some of our rooms and shower stalls, and the lack of an elevator are well-documented on this site, our site, and elsewhere, the staff behavior is definitely an aberration.  I have shown your review to all of my staff.  This is not our policy at all.  
I will find out the details around that incident to ensure it will not be repeated.
We hope you otherwise enjoyed your time in Cambridge.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Peaceful and economical by Boston Standars
data.text: If you like big hotel experiences then it isn't for you but it provides a very peaceful, comfortable location to visit Boston and especially the Harvard area. Our family of 4 had one of the family rooms and felt very comfortable. Yes the bunks aren't huge but for an average size person are very comfortable. The place is spotless and well maintained. Not sure what Jbroag's prob was but disagree with all the issues raised and breaky not an omlette cooking etc buffet provides wholesome filling food and drink. Coffee very good by American standards. Very different from the formula fair so many of the chains sell as a 'hot breakfast buffet'. Lots of space and great wifi. Really nothing but cudos for providing a welcoming space at a reasonable cost in anotherwise expensive city. Oh and parking is free...

data.title: Ghetto
data.text: This place was expensive and very low service. Room was on the fourth floor and long and skinny...we felt like we had been shoved in an attic closet. Bathrooms no better than a gas station... Actually worse because they were so tiny. Breakfast was dull: rubber eggs and a few muffins. And we had to request a plate. Front desk wasn't professional. Most looked and acted like they had rolled out of bed. Couldn't recommend. Pictures look nice, but trust me this place will be a disappointment.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  I understand our guest house is not for everyone.  We try to accurately describe our accommodations to all, so no one will be disappointed, but we do not always succeed.

We hope you otherwise enjoyed your time in Cambridge.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly bed and breakfast
data.text:
A sympathetic place, clean, calm, relaxed. We had ordered a room for 3 adults. The room we got was small with a queen size and a bulk bed for two (one above the other). The queen was fine, the bunk however to narrow and there was not really enough head clearance for adults. Fortunately my daughters are slim an short... :-)
We liked the (included) breakfast buffet, and the helpfull staff.

The house is only about ten walking minutes off the center with any kind of shops and restaurants. The Harvard campus is huge and just besides the bed and breakfast. It offers many attractions (exhibitions, museums, markets, street music,aso.).

data.title: Old home close to Harvard
data.text: Irving House feels more like an old home than a B&B. Even if it does have an old hotel hallways and 44 rooms, it doesn´t quite seem that way. I was visiting Harvard with my daughter and Irving House was very comfortable and convenient for that. It DOES have the same 2 problems that most B&B`s have 1) there´s an inch open on the bottom of the door, so you hear everything from the hallway (especially if someone parks there to have a long skype chat) and 2) the building is not really designed for this kind of capacity so you are bound to have an AC central unit operating on all-the-time full capacity not too far from you and vibrating the whole house. Both are minor inconveniences one can easily adapt to. Will return, should I need it.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us!  
I hear your concerns and on #1, we have taken steps to remedy the noise transmission from the door by providing 'snakes' to put along the bottom of the door.  This blocks light as well, which some guests have appreciated.  These 'snakes' are hanging on the doors, or should be!

But, yes, the central AC has been chugging away, and is not always quiet, especially during the heat wave we have been experiencing. 

We are pleased you enjoyed your stay overall, and if you return in cooler weather, the house may be quieter by a good bit!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Somewhere in between a hotel and a B&B, but a great place to stay
data.text: Lodgings in Cambridge are always ridiculously expensive, and Irving House is no exception. However, I do think that you get a little more for your money than at the local competition. The location is excellent, just a few blocks away from Harvard Yard in a residential neighborhood. Our room (#107) was comfortable, spacious, and had a newly renovated bathroom. Breakfast is pretty good (a nice array of coffees and teas, fruit, cereal, and bakery) although the hot items are very limited. And the desk staff are friendly and competent. There are two potential disadvantages, depending on your circumstances. While parking is available, the lot is so cramped that it's difficult to use unless you have a small car or excellent driving skills. And there is no elevator. If you are not able to walk stairs (it's a four-story building plus a basement where breakfast is served), you should ask for a room on a lower floor.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your kind and specific review!  You are right, those limitations on our accommodations do pose problems for some guests, and they are so far not fixable.  
We are always looking into ways to improve our breakfast, and will see how we can add to our hot items array, which has been growing in response to guests' requests.

We appreciate your comments to help us improve.  Future guests will appreciate them too!  We hope you are among them...
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Do it!
data.text:
If you are looking for a convenient bed and a breakfast in the Cambridge area this is the place to try. I wish I had discovered it a year ago.  I visit my daughter in Cambridge and have payed  the high price  at the local major chain hotels. 
There is no fuss to this place, but quaint atmosphere, snacks available and all the basics. I was even in a room where I shared  a bathroom which I thought would be a  challenge - but wasn't. I can't wait to try it again!

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Millimom!
Thank you for this very kind and specific review.  I want and need to hear how we can improve, but we LOVE to hear how we are doing well.

We look forward to your future visits!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Hostel Type Experience at B&B Irving House
data.text: The Irving House is set up similar to a hostel. The room I selected did not have a private bathroom; but there were 2 shared bathrooms on each floor - 1 full bathroom with bathtub and shower and 1 with sink and toilet. Not too bad as whenever I wanted to use the bathroom it was usually available. My single room was very tiny with the single bed taking up almost half the room. A desk and night table was also in the room with a small TV on the wall with the standard cable channels. The bed did not have a head board so it made it uncomfortable to watch TV or read in bed. A closet was also available which was very roomy. Everything was clean - the room and bathrooms included. The bed was comfortable and was made up daily. The excellent AC kept the room at a comfortable temp. The desk personnel were friendly and accommodating with 24 hour service and a computer terminal is available off the lobby. I was impressed with the buffet breakfast which is included with the hotel fees - with 4 kinds of coffee to choose from, scrambled eggs, quiche tarts, muffins, cereals, and fruit. There are comfortable seating areas both inside and outside if you wish to talk or read. The hotel is both quirky and funky with paintings for sale in the down stairs eating area. A fridge and microwave is available downstairs. The inn is in a residential area located about a 10 min walk from Harvard University and a 12 min walk to Harvard Square where you can catch the subway. Parking is available beside and behind the inn; but don't know if they charged for parking as I didn't have a car. The inn is not inexpensive as I paid about $144 which includes taxes for a tiny room with shared bathrooms; but I believe it is in the budget range for Boston accommodations which are very expensive. There are larger rooms with private bathrooms included at the inn; but are obviously more expensive then what I paid. It was a pleasant place to stay and convenient to Harvard U; but for the price I paid I would expect a larger room and a private bathroom.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your thorough and thoughtful review of your stay with us!  I think you have provided a very accurate picture of our guesthouse.
We do NOT charge extra for parking, and it is limited, so we are very happy to accommodate guests who arrive without a car...the house is convenient to public transit, as you note, one of the advantages of our location.  
Our rates are lower than most any place you will find in the Harvard Square area, and a real value when you include the breakfast, wifi and parking amenities.
We are pleased you enjoyed your stay.  We hope to see you again some time.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pleasantly satisfied
data.text:
After reading several scathing reviews on Irving House at Harvard, I was beginning to feel buyer's remorse..I booked a one night stay prior to a week-long trip to Provincetown as a stopover after flying in from the West Coast.  I thought to myself, "Well, it's only for one night..."  However, I can now say I am confident that Irving House is an excellent value for the dollar.   This is particularly the case given that Boston-area lodging is exorbitantly expensive.

     While I would not recommend Irving House for those travelers more accustomed to 4 and 5-star accommodations at full service boutique or chain hotels, it's more than adequate for those more used to "European-style" lodging - comfortable, functional and serves the purpose of simply having a place to hang your hat temporarily.

     I believe there is a mixture of options at IH - I, fortunately, booked a room with a private bathroom, but I noticed a communal bathroom on my floor as well, so I assume there are more affordable options if you wish to share a water closet and shower with your fellow lodgers.    

   My room (on the second floor) was spotless - particularly the bathroom - and had both a mixture of old world Boston charm (the hotel is in a former large home or boarding house) and renovations - including recent lighting fixtures, a comfortable bed and mattress and a flat screen tv with cable.   My room had a charming octagonal window above the bed that let in a fair amount of sunlight as well as a side window and high ceilings.  Additionally the bed was comfortable and I slept very well - the mattress was quite firm however (which I prefer).

    Some people have complained about staff being rude - I did not find this to be the case whatsoever.  While admittedly, I had minimal contact with hotel employees, my check in went smoothly and the staff were professional and courteous.   It is true that there are no elevators available - it is indeed an older, larger home on a quiet, tree-lined, residential side street - so those who have difficulty with or don't like climbing a few flights of stairs might want to seek a room on a lower level or opt for alternative lodging.

    The breakfast was expanded continental fair - I usually skip continental breakfast, but didn't in this case...There were delicious home made, artisan pastries - ham and cheese filled croissants, broccoli, egg and cheese tartlets, fresh veggies (cherry tomatoes and baby carrots), fresh cut fruit, decent coffee, scrambled eggs and all varieties of toasted breads.    Very satisfying meal.

     At under $150, I would consider my stay at Irving House at Harvard well worth the money.   The charm, comfort, proximity to Cambridge (totally walkable) and delicious breakfast all contributing to a decent stay.   While I might not necessarily rush back when I return to Boston, I wouldn't hesitate to stay again if my travel schedule involved the Boston area and my budget required a quick night or two stay at an affordable price.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for staying with us in spite of hearing the voices of unhappy travelers! 
We are very pleased you enjoyed your stay.  There are times when the room you occupied does have a rate of under $150.  We always aim to have our rates be among the very lowest in the Harvard Square area, and include important amenities that then make our offering a true value.

We hope to see you again some time.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Will not repeat
data.text:
The breakfast was excellent with lots of fresh options to choose from.
We traveled with grandma and rented a room with a double bed and a "bunk bed".  We got a third floor room.  There is no elevator.  The stairs are of course as old as the house so it was quite a workout for grandma to make it to the top floor.  The room was relatively clean but the carpets (in the room and all over the B&B) seem to be very, very old and very, very dusty.  May can be very hot and there are no a/c units.  Supposedly the "central a/c" was working but we were all sweaty for the 2 nights at this place.  When I called to ask about the a/c they offered me a fan that never arrived (and I didn't ask again about it because grandma was concern of the dust in the rugs could cause her asthma).  The bathroom is as tiny as an RV's and it smelled because of lack of air circulation.   The hair dryer was so old that only blowed cool air, so I couldn't even think about styling my hair.  The staff wasn't friendly or helpful except in the dining room where all were courteous and helpful.
For the B&B:  Change your carpets and rugs, get an efficient a/c, get an elevator at least for the handicapped, and be nice to your customers.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  I am very sorry you did not find all to your liking.
While we have been replacing carpets in some areas of the house, we had not gotten to all of them before our high season started, so, yes, there are some rooms still needing attention.  They are on the schedule for this fall. Our daily vacuuming and frequent shampooing do remove dirt and allergens, however, so I hope that there was no reaction to dust from them.
We keep our ac thermostat at 72-75 degrees Fahrenheit.  While this is comfortable for most travelers, it is not as low as some people like it.  Also, I wonder if a previous guest had closed the vent to the room you occupied?  It should have been checked by housekeeping, and I will remind them of that.
If we could install an elevator of any kind, we would have done so long ago.  I am sorry to say that current regulations and the layout of the house preclude that possibility, a limitation we deal with every day....
As for the behavior of my staff, I have shared with them your comments and my unhappiness about those comments.  This is not what I seek, train for and expect from my staff at the desk or anywhere else in the house.  
I hope you otherwise enjoyed your time in Cambridge.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Terrible hospitality and rip-off price
data.text:
As the title all says, this place is the worst place I have stayed so far. The price per night was 280 dollars which is not that bad in Cambridge and Boston area. However, (1) the room was extremely tiny (NO closet, one bed + desk ONLY which occupy > 95% space in the bedroom). I barely located even my luggage. (2) The space or next door is under construction. So I had to wake up at 7 am with drilling sounds! (3) The quality of foods at breakfast was poor. Don't go with pictures on their website. (4) NO refrigerator in the room. NO individual shampoo and body cleanser given. (5) Most importantly, most staffs and the manager (maybe owner?) are not customer friendly.

I DO NOT recommend this place.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay.  I am very sorry to see how you feel about it.
Yes, many of our rooms are small, built that way in the 1920s for Harvard students.  While we have done significant renovations and eliminated some of them (to create more private baths), about half of the rooms in the house are still under 100 square feet in size.  Where we can fit closets, we do.  In my travels I have stayed in plenty of places with rooms similar to these.
And Yes, Harvard's graduate student housing next door is having its bricks pointed.  This process has been somewhat disruptive for some guests, though they are only working 8-4, Monday-Friday.
The photos on our web site are actual depictions of our breakfast menu.  I am not sure how to respond to your statement that these are misleading.  In fact, the photos to do not show the wider variety of items we now offer each morning.
While it is true that we do not offer refrigerators in each guest room, this is for both space and environmental considerations.  We do have a refrigerator near our dining room specifically for guest use.  
Also in keeping with best environmental practices, we offer high quality bath amenities in dispensers in the baths.  This reduces waste of both soaps and their small containers.
Your final and most important comment about the attitude of our staff is the most troubling.  As our business is hospitality, I hire people who have a pleasant demeanor and include gracious, intelligent, attentive hospitality in all of our training for all staff.  I have shown them your comments (posted here and elsewhere) to remind them of the importance of kindness with every single guest. 
I am very sorry you did not have a pleasant experience with us.  I hope the rest of your stay in Cambridge was to your liking.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great affordable bed and breakfast
data.text: Great location reasonable prices however there were 4 flights of stairs and no elevator!  I had a large bag. Thankfully they had someone to help with the bag.  The air was not as cool as I like it.  But they did have a fan!  Good for young people but not for ladies if certain age.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your kind and thoughtful review!  Yes, we have no elevator, and help with luggage when we can.  Our central air conditioning is set for F70-72 degrees and we hope that the fans in the room help to make that comfortable.

Ladies of a certain age are very welcome and accommodated in response to their requests for lower floors, or quiet rooms, and such.  In fact, many women prefer Irving House because even though we are a large guesthouse, we still maintain a homey atmosphere that contributes to safety and security of all guests.

We hope to see you again some time...
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Little Gem with big services
data.text: Loved this little gem. Lovely selection at breakfast in the breakfast room. Fresh baked snacks most of the day. No elevator so be sure you can carry your bags up.24 hour desk service. Few blocks from Harvard Square and shops and restaurants. Cute neighborhood but construction next door on weekdays so select room accordingly. Some parking in back and down the street but fills up at night

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your kind and thoughtful review!  The construction you experienced is going to continue throughout the summer, alas.  Harvard University is repointing its brick walls on the student housing next door.  While we know this is an inconvenience during the work hours (Monday-Friday, 8-4) we hope that most guests are out of their rooms and enjoying Cambridge.  Where and when we can, we assign rooms away from the north side of the house for guests who are coming from different time zones or otherwise wish to sleep during the work hours...
We also thank you for pointing out the limitations of our parking lot.  We do all we can to accommodate the cars guests bring, but co-operation is much appreciated in this tight urban setting...
We look forward to seeing you again some time....
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good alternative to a hotel
data.text: I have stayed at this guest house twice now whilst visiting family in Cambridge. It is an excellent alternative to hotels in the immediate area. Firstly it is brilliantly located in a suburban street but only a 10 minute walk to Harvard Square and the shops, restaurants and subway into Boston itself. The rooms vary in size but are a real value for money proposition. Some come with an ensuite whilst others are shared bathroom on the same floor.   Breakfast is provided downstairs and is simple but comprehensive in its offering. There is a laundry and dryer for those of us who have been travelling for some time without capacity or time to wash and dry clothes. Staff are friendly and helpful

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind and helpful review!  We look forward to seeing you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: 3 stars for the room, 5 stars for the coffee
data.text: My room was quiet and perfectly comfortable but extremely small for the price, hence the 3 stars.  The breakfast, however, included 5 star coffee and high quality organic options so I guess you could say that the quality of the breakfast is reflected in price of the room.  I appreciated the availability of excellent coffee in the afternoon which I was able to enjoy on the front porch.  The walk to the T was fine as I was lucky with the weather.  (Not sure I would have enjoyed the porch or the walk otherwise).

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your thoughtful review.  We are very pleased you like our coffee.  As this is a particularly challenging thing to get right, we aim to please several different tastes....
The rooms that were created in the 1920s for Harvard students are our smallest rooms.  While they are small, we price them accordingly and have larger rooms in the house as well.
We hope to see you if your travels bring you back to Cambridge!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfy but snug
data.text:
Front desk staff were friendly and efficient.  I had a room on the fourth floor.  There's no elevator here so I got my exercise.  The bed was comfy; the bathroom a bit cramped.  Breakfast was a nice buffet with good variety.  There is free off-street parking but the spaces are quite small.  The location is very convenient to Harvard.

Overall, a nice B&B.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  We are please you found us to your liking...
Yes, most of the fourth floor bath rooms are snug.  We hope the skylights installed in most of them give a slightly more open feel....
We are pleased you enjoyed your stay in some ways.  We hope to see you again if your travels bring you back to Our Fair City!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: In Boston? Head for Cambridge
data.text:
Irving House is just that - a real house. It's not like a hotel; no sterile decor or wrapped soaps. It's friendly, warm and comfortable. A single room with shared bath worked brilliantly. I was entertained by squirrels on the walkway outside my room. It was quiet. I slept beautifully on a fabulous bed. Breakfast included - muesli, cereals, toast, pastries and so on. Choice of coffees and teas.
It's also in picturesque Cambridge, a few steps from Harvard. This means good coffee, a range of cuisines, gardens full of spring blossom (ah, the dogwood), a quick subway trip into town.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your kind and thoughtful review!  We are pleased you enjoyed your stay and offered some helpful particulars to other travelers.  We hop to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A great weekend retreat
data.text: With comfortable beds, huge breakfast choices, free parking, outdoor seating areas, helpful staff and a central (but quiet) location, Irving House will continue to be the choice for our Cambridge weekends at the ART.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Woo Hoo!  So glad you like Irving House! AND the ART!  It is one of my favorite theatres..
We look forward to your future visits..
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good for study at Harvard
data.text:
Basic but friendly place. Good and healty breakfast. People at front desk 24 hours are so kindly.
You can hear the noise of your neighbors at shower. Floors on wood are not really shock absorbers.
But the rest is so quiet.

owner_response.author: Rachael S, Owner at Irving House at Harvard, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  I am sorry that the sound transmission was so apparent for you.  We have not found a solution for that, but we do keep looking...

We are pleased that in some ways you did enjoy your stay.  We hope to see you again some time!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
